Season 7 opens with Gaetano Donizetti's comic opera "L'Elisir d'Amore," about a peasant (Matthew Polenzani) who wins the heart of a beautiful farm owner (Anna Netrebko) with the help of a love potion he purchased from a quack doctor (Ambrogio Maestri).
Verdi's "Otello," about a Moorish general (Johan Botha) who comes to suspect his wife (Ren√©e Fleming) of infidelity due to seeds of doubt sowed by a treacherous aide (Falk Struckmann).
The Metropolitan Opera performs this production of Thomas Ad√®s's "The Tempest."

Mozart's "La Clemenza di Tito" stars El?na Garan?a in the trouser role of Sesto, who finds himself enmeshed in an assassination plot against Roman emperor Titus (Giuseppe Filianoti) through the manipulations of vengeful Vitellia (Barbara Frittoli), the daughter of a deposed emperor, after her hopes of becoming his consort are dashed.
Verdi's "Un Ballo in Maschera," about a Swedish king (Marcelo √Ålvarez) pursuing an affair with his best friend's wife (Sondra Radvanovsky).

Verdi's "Rigoletto" is updated to 1960s-era Las Vegas, where a womanizing lounge singer (Piotr Beczala) seduces the daughter (Diana Damrau) of his sidekick (Zeljko Lu?i?), causing his pal to seek revenge by hiring a hit man (Stefan Koc√°n) to off him.
Liudmyla Monastyrska and Roberto Alagna star in Verdi's "Aida," about a military commander in ancient Egypt who risks his life for the love of an enslaved Ethiopian princess. Fabio Luisi conducts.

Berlioz's "Les Troyens," about a Trojan military commander (Bryan Hymel) who flees the fallen Troy and lands in the North African kingdom of Carthage, where he falls for the queen (Susan Graham). Deborah Voigt plays Cassandra, the Trojan prophetess whose warnings about an apparent gift from the Greeks are ignored.
A performance of Gaetano Donizetti's "Maria Stuarda," about the rivalry between Mary, Queen of Scots (Joyce DiDonato) and Elizabeth I (Elza van den Heever).

Richard Wagner's "Parsifal," about a fool (Jonas Kaufmann) who may be key to a wounded king's recovery. The cast also includes Ren√© Pape as knight Gurnemanz; Katarina Dalayman as siren Kundry; Peter Mattei as King Amfortas; and Evgeny Nikitin as Klingsor, the evil wizard.
Season 6 opens with Gaetano Donizetti's "Anna Bolena," based on the last days of Anne Boleyn (Anna Netrebko), the second wife of British monarch Henry VIII (Ildar Abdrazakov).

Baritone Mariusz Kwiecien stars as the serial seducer "Don Giovanni," who swaggers his way to eternal damnation in this production of Mozart's 1787 masterpiece, which costars soprano Barbara Frittoli as the fiery Donna Elvira and tenor Ram√≥n Vargas as the nobleman Don Ottavio.

A performance of Philip Glass' "Satyagraha," about the early years of Mahatma Gandhi (Richard Croft). The production costars Rachelle Durkin, Alfred Walker and Kim Josephson; and features large-scale puppetry and sets made of corrugated metal and newspaper.

Ren√©e Fleming stars in the title role of Handel's "Rodelinda," a baroque opera about a queen and her assumed-dead husband (Andreas Scholl), and the usurper (Joseph Kaiser) who wants Rodelinda for his wife.

A production of Gounod's "Faust" updates the story to the mid-20th century, with Faust (Jonas Kaufmann) now a nuclear scientist who strikes a deal with the devil (Ren√© Pape) in order to win the affections of a young woman (Marina Poplavskaya).

"The Enchanted Island," a Jeremy Sams pasticcio about the war between Prospero and Sycorax from "The Tempest" being interrupted by the four lovers from "A Midsummer Night's Dream," whose honeymoon cruise has shipwrecked on the island. William Christie conducts the work, which features music primarily from Handel. Deborah Voigt hosts.

A production of Verdi's "Ernani," about a maiden (Angela Meade) who is romantically pursued by her uncle (Ferruccio Furlanetto), the Spanish king (Dmitri Hvorostovsky) and a bandit (Marcello Giordani).

Soprano Anna Netrebko stars in Jules Massenet's "Manon," about a country girl who, while on her way to a convent, falls for a young man (Piotr Beczala) before succumbing to a promise of a luxurious life offered by a rich nobleman (Christophe Mortagne).

Soprano Natalie Dessay stars in Willy Decker's stylized production of Verdi's "La Traviata," about a frail courtesan who sacrifices her happiness in order to spare her beloved (Matthew Polenzani) and his family any strife her reputation could cause them.
Filmmaker Susan Froemke examines the challenges that director Robert Lepage and the Metropolitan Opera faced in mounting a production of Richard Wagner's "Ring" cycle.

The Season 5 premiere features Donizetti's comic "Don Pasquale," starring soprano Anna Netrebko as a penniless young woman who tricks the wealthy Don (John Del Carlo) into thinking he's married her, then acts like a shrew so that he will consent to her marrying his nephew Ernesto (Matthew Polenzani).

Mussorgsky's "Boris Godunov" stars bass Ren√© Pape as the 16th-century Russian tsar whose reign is challenged by a novice monk (Aleksandrs Antonenko) masquerading as the dead Tsarevich Dimitri, whose murder opened the door for Boris' ascension. The cast also includes mezzo-soprano Ekaterina Semenchuk as Princess Marina, bass-baritone Evgeny Nikitin as Rangoni and bass Mikhail Petrenko as Pimen. The title role is considered one of the greatest bass roles in opera.

Verdi's "Don Carlo," about a Spanish prince (Roberto Alagna) who falls for the French princess (Marina Poplavskaya) he's supposed to marry as part of a Spanish-French peace treaty, only to have his father (Ferruccio Furlanetto) decide to wed her himself.
A production of Puccini's "La Fanciulla del West," about an Old West saloon owner (Deborah Voigt) in a California gold-rush town who'll stop at nothing to get the man (Marcello Giordani) she wants.

A production of Christoph Willibald Gluck's "Iphig√©nie en Tauride," based on a Greek myth in which a high priestess (Susan Graham) is reunited with her brother (Placido Domingo) after a lengthy separation.

Composer John Adams conducts the Met premiere of his acclaimed opera "Nixon in China," about the 37th U.S. president's historic 1972 visit to communist China. Baritone James Maddalena, who created the role of Nixon in the original 1987 production, stars, with Janis Kelly as Pat Nixon; Richard Paul Fink as Henry Kissinger; Robert Brubaker as Mao Zedong; Kathleen Kim as Mao's wife Chiang Ch'ing; and Russell Braun as Chou En-lai.

Natalie Dessay stars in Donizetti's "Lucia di Lammermoor" as the fragile title character, whose brother (Ludovic T√©zier) forces her into an arranged marriage due to his hatred for the family of the man (Joseph Calleja) she loves. Host: Ren√©e Fleming.
Rossini's comic "Le Comte Ory" stars Juan Diego Fl√≥rez in the title role, a count who competes with his page (Joyce DiDonatofor, in a trouser role) for the hand of a lonely countess (Diana Damrau).

Ren√©e Fleming stars in Richard Strauss' "Capriccio," about a widowed countess who ponders whether the music or the written word is more important to musical drama while being wooed by a composer (Joseph Kaiser) and a poet (Russell Braun).

A production of Verdi's "Il Trovatore," in which brothers (Marcelo √Ålvarez, Dmitri Hvorostovsky) compete for the affections of the same woman (Sondra Radvanovsky). Dolora Zajick costars as Azucena, the gypsy with a dark secret.

Season 4 opens with Luc Bondy's staging of Puccini's "Tosca," starring soprano Karita Mattila as the title character, whose lover (Marcelo √Ålvarez) is arrested by a police chief (George Gagnidze) and threatened with death unless she gives herself to him.

A documentary about the 2007 Metropolitan Opera National Council Auditions, in which contestants compete for cash prizes and the opportunity to launch a major operatic career. The competition is seen through the eyes of three hopefuls, including fiery 22-year-old Michael Fabiano; 25-year-old Alek Shrader, who tries to sing nine high Cs in a difficult aria; and 30-year-old Ryan Smith, who has little formal training.

Giuseppe Verdi's 1871 opera +Aida receives an interpretation by the Metropolitan Opera in this production from 2009. As directed for the stage by Gary Halvorson, and executive produced by Peter Gelb, it stars Roberto Scandiuzzi as Famfis, Johan Botha as Radam√®s, Dolora Zajick as 5Amneris and Violeta Urmana in the title role. The Metropolitan Opera, Orchestra, Chorus and Ballet lend accompaniment, with Donald Palumbo serving as chorus master and Daniele Gatti conducting. Gianni Quaranta designed the sets, Dada Saligeri created the costumes, and Alexei Ratmansky choreographed.
The Puccini opera "Turandot," about a ruthless Chinese princess (Maria Guleghina) who falls for an unknown prince (Marcello Giordani).

The Bananas try to make it rain in bone-dry Cuddlestown.
The Bananas get worried when Bernard tells them that the Snippys are coming to take over the lake and eat everything in sight.
Morgan surprises the Bananas one morning with a roar and says that he is no longer a Teddy bear but a grown-up bear.
Rat becomes obsessed with playing golf and never opens his shop, to the dismay of everyone in town.
The Bananas search for the missing last page of a book that Amy was reading to them.

The Bananas and the Teddies rush to see Rat because he has an important announcement. Once they get to his shop, Rat proudly tells them that he has a dream. A wonderful dream. His dream is to become a circus clown!
Rat's mother visits and recommends that he make some changes to his shop.
The Bananas investigate when several holes suddenly appear in the park.
Rat gets upset when his hat gets damaged so the Bananas and the Teddies try to find him a new one.
Rat tries to attract more visitors to Cuddlestown so he will get more customers.
In an attempt to impress the Teddies, B1 and B2 make Rat disappear in a magic trick but, when they try to bring him back, it seems that Rat has vanished forever!
In case he wants a midnight snack, Morgan moves his bed to the kitchen. The Bananas think this is an amazing idea and that they will never have to get out of bed again!
B1 and B2 find a trapped fish called Twinkle and take her home, but Twinkle tries to escape and the Bananas can't figure out why.
Trying to mend things, the Bananas get stuck together and when the Teddies and Charlie try to help, they get glued too! How will they solve this sticky situation?
Everyone is excited when a real life Prince arrives in Cuddlestown but, with the Teddies help, they discover he is not what he seems...
When Morgan's toy bunny goes missing it's time for the Banana detectives to try and track it down.
The Bananas build a race cart but, unfortunately for Topsy, it isn't really that safe!
A loud little bird is waking up the Bananas, so with Charlie's help, they make a scarecrow. Will it scare the bird away?
When Pedro the Pig gets sick, the Bananas kindly look after him. Seeing all the attention he is getting, Dolly and Camembert pretend to be ill too.
The Bananas are jealous of Rat's collection of cheese crumbs, but the problem is that they can't work out what to collect.
